alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:15AM EST until December 19 at 4:17PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Unadilla. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins to impact fields and some properties in Unadilla between Main Street and River Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Tuesday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage by early afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 415 PM EST.
